text: mujadara is a traditional Middle Eastern
dish you can make straight from your
pantry I freshened it up with spring
greens step 1
saute our leeks you have to make sure to
get them really crispy really brown
because they add both flavor and then a
little bit of texture to the finished
dish don't skimp on the oil you want to
use about a quarter of a cup if you
don't have enough oil in the pan they're
not gonna get crispy make sure to clean
the leeks really well the leeks are
gonna take about 5 to 10 minutes I've
just removed half of them I'm gonna
leave the other half in the pan and then
it can flavor the lentils at rice now
this is really important you have to
season the leeks with salt right after
they come out of the pan while they're
still warm do this with all fried foods
because if you wait till it cools it's
not going to absorb the salt flavor add
the garlic you just want to saute the
garlic until you can smell it Dani add
rice saute this for about 2 minutes
now I'm gonna bloom the spices in the
oil so I've got cumin allspice and
cayenne while this has been cooking I've
been soaking my lentils in warm water
for about ten minutes this just helps
soften them up now I'm going to drain
them and add them
that is a hot pan I'm going to add bay
leaf cinnamon sauce and four and a half
cups of water I'm going to bring this up
to a simmer I'm gonna cover the pot let
it cook for about 15 minutes and we're
gonna add the Greens the lentils and
rice are almost finished cooking they've
got about five minutes to go so at this
point I'm going to add in the greens
cover the pot and then let the Greens
steam after five minutes just turn off
the heat and let it sit for another five
now I'm just gonna add a little bit of
hot sauce which I love not traditional
but yummy and then the crispy leeks as
they say in Arabic saut ten
